text.p: The following are leading domestic stories in Portuguese newspapers.
- In a preliminary report, the Commission to Reform the Social Security System has proposed cutting state retirement pensions.
- A consortium formed by oil companies Petrogal, BP, Mobil, Shell and Borealis plans to invest 8.5 billion escudos in a new gas terminal at Sines in southern Portugal.

- The jury in the privatisation of chemicals company Quimigal will consider two competing bids, by banking group Mello and Rentipar, a new company formed by managers of Quimigal, by the end of the week.

- Public Works Minister Joao Cravinho will propose the formation of a new company that will study the construction of the new international airport at Lisbon. It will cost around 300 billion escudos and be ready in 2007.

- Managers from Saudi Arabia have shown interest in buying shares of Portugal Telecom in the third phase of the privatisation of the company, the president of the Portuguese-Arab Chamber of Commerce, Angelo Correia, said.

- The partnership between oil company Petrogal and Saudi Aramco will help boost exports of Saudi oil to Portugal, said Sheikh Ismail Abudawood, the head of a Saudi business delegation which visited Portugal last week. This will guarantee stocks held by Petrogal.
- Since last Tuesday turnover in newly privatised utility EDP - Electricidade de Portugal totalled 29.7 million shares, 25 percent of the listed stock.
